intro: Xylosma serpentina, commonly known as the serpentine xylosma, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Xylosma serpentina is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in desert ecosystems.
